title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Portrait of Fleabag star Phoebe Waller-Bridge, 34, hangs in a new women-only club
text:
London’s most exclusive clubs normally have an oil painting of the Queen hanging in pride of place. But the capital’s newest members-only venue pays homage to a new living legend – Phoebe Waller-Bridge.

A portrait of the Fleabag star, 34, has become the focal point of a new women-only Fitzrovia members’ club The Wing, where the annual sign-up fee is £1,836. Its celebrity members include Poppy Delevingne, Alexa Chung and Sinéad Burke.

They have been posing with this picture all week and adding gushing feminist tributes to the Killing Eve writer, who just signed a £50 million deal with Amazon and has been offered free membership to the club.

Alexa, pictured below with the portrait, said: ‘Proud to be a member of a women-focused club where you can hang with other driven gals, painted or otherwise.’ Not cultish at all then...

Alexa, pictured with the portrait, said: ‘Proud to be a member of a women-focused club where you can hang with other driven gals, painted or otherwise’

The capital’s newest members-only venue pays homage to a new living legend – Phoebe Waller-Bridge

This is the moment Daniel Craig realised he’ll never have to utter the immortal words ‘Bond, James Bond’ again.

After 13 years of playing 007, Daniel’s tenure in the role is finally over and he celebrated the final day of filming for his last Bond film – No Time To Die – by posting a ‘that’s a wrap’ picture with director Cary Joji Fukunaga and the film’s clapper board.

It’s the 25th Bond movie and it has been blighted by resignations and injuries, so I’m sure Daniel will be delighted to be able to spend more time at home with wife Rachel Weisz, and enjoying a stiff drink. As long as it’s anything but a Martini.

This is the moment Daniel Craig realised he’ll never have to utter the immortal words ‘Bond, James Bond’ again

Relations between Princes William and Harry may be a little frosty, but they share one thing – a penchant for £400 slippers.

William wore black velvet Arthur Sleep slippers on his recent tour of Pakistan, while Harry was given a pair, below, by the Army last year as a wedding gift.

‘William’s are plain but Harry’s have the insignia of his old regiment embroidered with 18-carat gold thread,’ says firm boss Chris Boadle.

‘William’s are plain but Harry’s have the insignia of his old regiment embroidered with 18-carat gold thread,’ says firm boss Chris Boadle

A baby’s first haircut is a big deal to most parents, but Rosie Huntington-Whiteley, below, went way over the top when she took her two-year-old old son Jack for a trim with the Duchess of Sussex’s personal hair stylist George Northwood.

‘There is no one else in the world that I would think of cutting his hair apart from you,’ the 32-year-old M&S model gushed on his podcast. ‘I think I’ve always felt that way.’

Calm down love… it’s a haircut, not the final scene of a Richard Curtis rom-com!
description: TALK OF THE TOWN: A portrait of the Fleabag star, 34, has become the focal point of a new women-only Fitzrovia members' club The Wing, where the annual sign-up fee is £1,836.
authors: Charlotte Griffiths For The Mail On Sunday
